etymologies: mid 16th century: from French polygamie, via late Latin from Greek polugamia, from polugamos ‘often marrying’

definitions: the practice or custom of having more than one wife or husband at the same time.
shortDefinitions: practice or custom of having more than one wife or husband at same time

definitions: a pattern of mating in which an animal has more than one mate.
shortDefinitions: pattern of mating in which animal has more than one mate

definitions: the condition of bearing some flowers with stamens only, some with pistils only, and some with both, on the same or different plants.
shortDefinitions: condition of bearing some flowers with stamens only, some with pistils only, and some with both
